values.description:
Tests helped to uncover a few bugs which should now be fixed:
 
- creating a new simulation should now increment the next simulation id 

-  terminating a simulation now update's its state to `Terminated`

- changed simulation loading to use sim id instead of mongodb's unique id.

- added authentication checking before resolving simulation params (`simulationId`)

- update simulation (PUT `/simulations/:simulationId`) now works only for running simulations
values.title: Add simulation tests and bug fixes

summary.raw:
Tests helped to uncover a few bugs which should now be fixed:
 
- creating a new simulation should now increment the next simulation id 

-  terminating a simulation now update's its state to `Terminated`

- changed simulation loading to use sim id instead of mongodb's unique id.

- added authentication checking before resolving simulation params (`simulationId`)

- update simulation (PUT `/simulations/:simulationId`) now works only for running simulations
summary.html:
Tests helped to uncover a few bugs which should now be fixed:

  • creating a new simulation should now increment the next simulation id

  • terminating a simulation now update's its state to Terminated

  • changed simulation loading to use sim id instead of mongodb's unique id.

  • added authentication checking before resolving simulation params (simulationId)

  • update simulation (PUT /simulations/:simulationId) now works only for running simulations

values.description:
When the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and WS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY are set in the environment, machines are going to be launched on AWS.

Otherwise, the "fake" cloud service is used.

Otherwise, the "fake" cloud service is used.

values.description:
With this pull request, you shouldn't be able to log in if your email is not in the users DB.

To test, first clear the user db:

1. `$ mongo`

1. `> use mean-dev`

1. `> db.users.remove()`

Now try to log in....

To add yourself back in use (while at the mongo prompt):

`> db.users.insert({email:'my_username@gmail.com', provider:'local'})`

Now you should be able to log in using the given email address.

You can also access the admin page by clicking on "Hi <Your Name>" in the top right corner of the front-end.
values.title: Add and remove users in an admin page

summary.raw:
With this pull request, you shouldn't be able to log in if your email is not in the users DB.

To test, first clear the user db:

1. `$ mongo`

1. `> use mean-dev`

1. `> db.users.remove()`

Now try to log in....

To add yourself back in use (while at the mongo prompt):

`> db.users.insert({email:'my_username@gmail.com', provider:'local'})`

Now you should be able to log in using the given email address.

You can also access the admin page by clicking on "Hi <Your Name>" in the top right corner of the front-end.
summary.html:
With this pull request, you shouldn't be able to log in if your email is not in the users DB.

To test, first clear the user db:

  1. $ mongo

  2. > use mean-dev

  3. > db.users.remove()

Now try to log in....

To add yourself back in use (while at the mongo prompt):

> db.users.insert({email:'my_username@gmail.com', provider:'local'})

Now you should be able to log in using the given email address.

You can also access the admin page by clicking on "Hi <Your Name>" in the top right corner of the front-end.

values.description:
The user preferences started to get big. This is just the front-end aspect. 

What is included:

1. fixes issue #24
1. Layout of the preferences view.

1. Add/edit/delete ssh keys. The keys are not sent to the server. This will be done in a future pull-request

1. Fixed the fade transitions between views.

values.description:
A script that loads the world on boot is passed when a server is loaded
- The server is also given a secret uuid token
- the server installs cloudsimi scripts upon boot
The server calls back to cloudsim.io when it is ready
- cloudsim.io updates the server state
values.title: Server callback when running

summary.raw:
A script that loads the world on boot is passed when a server is loaded
- The server is also given a secret uuid token
- the server installs cloudsimi scripts upon boot
The server calls back to cloudsim.io when it is ready
- cloudsim.io updates the server state
summary.html: A script that loads the world on boot is passed when a server is loaded - The server is also given a secret uuid token - the server installs cloudsimi scripts upon boot The server calls back to cloudsim.io when it is ready - cloudsim.io updates the server state

values.reason: This is broken due to the split between user and cloudsim user.

values.description:
This new schema contains user information specific to CloudSim (not in ThePropShop for example).

When a user is created in the User controller, a CloudSimUser is also created.
When the user is removed, the CloudSimUser is also removed

A new schema, and model are created, but there is no controller: the User controller is in charge of creating and deleting the CloudSimUser documents.

Importantly, your existing users in your database do not have the corresponding CloudSimUser documents, so its better to remove them and add new ones... otherwise, you will run into errors.

**This PR also fixes tests**

issue #43
values.title: CloudSimUser schema

Importantly, your existing users in your database do not have the corresponding CloudSimUser documents, so its better to remove them and add new ones... otherwise, you will run into errors.

values.description:
Part one of billing: Paypal integration

Added two Paypal buttons

- Paypal Sandbox Test button

- Actual Paypal button (need to change the id later to tie it to the OSRF paypal account)

To test:

1. npm install

2. Go ahead and purchase some Cloudsim credit in Preferences page.

Paypal sandbox test account:

- Username: osrfoundation@gmail.com 

- Password is the same old usual one (otherwise ping me for the password)

We can configure the button to use by changing the value of  `paypalSandbox` in `config/env/all.js`. By default it's the test button.


Actual balance update will be in part two done by @hugomatic
values.title: Paypal integration

values.title: Billing users for the simulation time used

values.description:
* before launch, check the available balance and get the money for the first hour
* every 20 sec, look for running sims that need to be charged for the next hour (and terminate sim if there is no money left in the account)
values.title: Billing users for simulation charges

summary.raw:
* before launch, check the available balance and get the money for the first hour
* every 20 sec, look for running sims that need to be charged for the next hour (and terminate sim if there is no money left in the account)
summary.html:
• before launch, check the available balance and get the money for the first hour
  • every 20 sec, look for running sims that need to be charged for the next hour (and terminate sim if there is no money left in the account)
